english_translation: Narrated by al-Sha'bi: When it was said to Masruq that he was slow (in supporting) Ali and his battles, and did not witness any of his battles, wanting to advise them truthfully, he said: I remind you by Allah, have you considered if when you lined up one against another and seized weapons against each other, killing one another, if a door from the sky were opened while you were watching, then an angel descended until he stood between the two rows and said: O you who believe, do not consume your wealth among yourselves in falsehood except by transaction of mutual consent, and do not kill yourselves. Indeed, Allah is with you, Most Merciful (Quran 4:29). Would that have been a barrier between you? They said: Yes. He said: By Allah, indeed Allah has opened a door for them from the sky, and an angel of honor has descended upon the tongue of your Prophet ﷺ, and it is firm in the Masahif, nothing has abrogated it.

english_translation: Narrated by Masruq ibn al-Ajda': We came to the Mother of the Believers Aisha, and she said: Churn honey for my two sons. Then she said: Taste it, and if something from it displeases you, add more honey to it, for if I were breaking fast, I would taste it. We said: O Mother of the Believers, we are fasting. She said: What kind of fasting is this? They said: We fasted this day, so if it is from Ramadan we will catch up with it, and if it is not from Ramadan it will be voluntary fasting. She said: Indeed fasting is the fasting of the people, and breaking is the breaking of the people, and sacrifice is the sacrifice of the people, but I fasted this month and it happened to coincide with Ramadan.

Second Chain: Narrated by Ibn 'Uyaynah from Ibrahim ibn Muhammad ibn al-Muntashir from his father: Masruq and his wife loved that one of them would go to the Euphrates, fetch a skin of water, sell it, and give the price in charity. Third Chain: Narrated by al-Fadl ibn Dukain from Hafs from al-A'mash from Abu al-Duhha from Masruq: He bought a ram and sacrificed it, and its owner would come to him saying: Give us something, bring us something.
